Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ALESSIO P
Reviews.Content: Very great quality/price rate. Rooms spacious and bathroom quite large. the restaurant food (Tapas Menu) quality is high, even if the list is too short. Internet access free without time limitations. Receptionist friendly, nice and helpful. Not the best location for the downtime, but easy to reach by car, parking, and subway station (Arturo Soria) is 5 minutes walking far.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place..”
Reviews.Author: phwagz
Reviews.Content: A nice place from which you can explore Madrid ..... great price ... good location with more than adequate amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly - but a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: Torsten_Krause
Reviews.Content: To start with - the receptionist was very friendly and helpful at check-in - but could not make a non-smoking room available, what of course wasn't her fault. Internet access is free, the room size is average, the batghroom fully equipped and clean. Breakfast is fine, the menue at the resturant is short, food not too impressive, but quality was ok. You won't have to bring your own alarm clock, as someone around you will have brought his and someone will have programmed the time you need. Room next to the eleavator can't be recommended, as a) you can it well in operation and b) all lively guests leaving the elevator can be well heard. It is not a downtown hotel, but if you leave the taxi and trun to the right you'll find taxis. To the underground is a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “it was okay!wouldn't recommend this hotel to any travellers”
Reviews.Author: chewygirl
Reviews.Content: I didn't thought the interior design of the hotel was as nice as other travellers describe. The location of the hotel from the metro station isn't great.It's a 12 min walk but because it's up on a hill, we find it quite tiring to walk back to the hotel after a long day of exploring the city. The rooms are clean but i hated the wall of the bathroom. felt like a prison wall to me. It's grey ,dull and there's no tiles on the wall but just cement? I am not fussy when it come to hotel. As long as it's clean and comfortable, i am happy! The worst thing of the hotel is they don't change your bedsheets everyday.they only change the sheets every 2 days. Even if you ask them to change it, they refuse too! Apparently it's their hotel policy and they didn't even listed on their website nor in their room. I only found out they didn't change my sheets when i accidently spill a lil bit of my eyeliner on the bed ! (how disgusting rite?) this incident really put me off and i would never stay in this hotel again even though it's slightly cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: tuoberg
Reviews.Content: Good but not better than that. The hotel has a nice interior design, close to the airport and city center. However, not too much opportunities can be found at a walking distance. The restaurant and breakfast is not good.

Reviews.Title: “good value, but location may not be ideal”
Reviews.Author: gnc-canada
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before a flight home and found this hotel to be in a quiet and safe neighborhood, five blocks from a Metro Station. This station is a half-hour from Madrid Center, and 15 minutes from the airport. Not a great location if you're touring Madrid. The buffet breakfast was adequate to good, staff were friendly, the room was clean , good beds and towels. Free wireless Internet . We got a good sleep here, and I would rate it 3 1/2 star overall.

Reviews.Title: “Not one I would recommend”
Reviews.Author: JasperC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here overnight on business and would not stay here again under any circumstances. The room was in a poor state, in fact the whole place was pretty run down. The service was ok but nothing spectacular. The braekfast was one of the worst I have had in the last year away on business. Location was way out of the main town deep in the suburbs.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: JAlvien
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night while vacationing in Madrid and all I can say is the room was very different from the offer showed through the internet. I booked a single room and it was tiny, located on the ground floor near the reception area, so the noise of the people doing the night cleaning awakened me several times. The bathroom had a strange smell though it was clean and well maintained. This will be certainly my last time in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the business or vacation traveler”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 10 day (4 Country) business trip and this was one of the many hotels I stayed at during my trip. This place turned out to be a great place to stay! It was in a very quiet neighborhood, it was very close to a Metro stop (about a block away), the rooms were nicely decorated, and they offered fee internet access to the guests. The rate was very reasonable for the quality of hotel. It is a bit far from the down town tourist area but who cares with the metro stop a block away.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Zenit Conde de Orgaz
HotelInfo.Address: Avda Moscatelar 24, 28043 Madrid, Spain
